segment.source: How to Move the MBAM 2.5 Websites
segment.target: How to Move the MBAM 2.5 Websites

segment.source: How to Move the MBAM 2.5 Websites
segment.target: How to Move the MBAM 2.5 Websites

segment.source: How to Move the MBAM 2.5 Websites
segment.target: How to Move the MBAM 2.5 Websites

segment.source: Use these procedures to move the following MBAM websites from one computer to another, that is, to move the following features from Server A to Server B:
segment.target: Use these procedures to move the following MBAM websites from one computer to another, that is, to move the following features from Server A to Server B:

segment.source: Administration and Monitoring Website
segment.target: Administration and Monitoring Website

segment.source: Self-Service Portal
segment.target: Self-Service Portal

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: During the configuration of both websites, you must provide the same connection string, Reports URL, group accounts, and web service application pool domain account as the ones that you are currently using.
segment.target: During the configuration of both websites, you must provide the same connection string, Reports URL, group accounts, and web service application pool domain account as the ones that you are currently using.

segment.source: If you don’t use the same values, you cannot access some of the servers.
segment.target: If you don’t use the same values, you cannot access some of the servers.

segment.source: To get the current values, use the Get-MbamWebApplication Windows PowerShell cmdlet.
segment.target: To get the current values, use the Get-MbamWebApplication Windows PowerShell cmdlet.

segment.source: To move the Administration and Monitoring Website to another server
segment.target: To move the Administration and Monitoring Website to another server

segment.source: On Server B, install the MBAM 2.5 Server software.
segment.target: On Server B, install the MBAM 2.5 Server software.

segment.source: For instructions, see Installing the MBAM 2.5 Server Software.
segment.target: For instructions, see Installing the MBAM 2.5 Server Software.

segment.source: On Server B, start the MBAM Server Configuration wizard, click Add New Features, and then select only the Administration and Monitoring Website feature.
segment.target: On Server B, start the MBAM Server Configuration wizard, click Add New Features, and then select only the Administration and Monitoring Website feature.

segment.source: Alternatively, you can use the Enable-MbamWebApplication Windows PowerShell cmdlet to configure the Administration and Monitoring Website.
segment.target: Alternatively, you can use the Enable-MbamWebApplication Windows PowerShell cmdlet to configure the Administration and Monitoring Website.

segment.source: For instructions on how to configure the Administration and Monitoring Website, see How to Configure the MBAM 2.5 Web Applications.
segment.target: For instructions on how to configure the Administration and Monitoring Website, see How to Configure the MBAM 2.5 Web Applications.

segment.source: To move the Self-Service Portal to another server
segment.target: To move the Self-Service Portal to another server

segment.source: On Server B, install the MBAM 2.5 Server software.
segment.target: On Server B, install the MBAM 2.5 Server software.

segment.source: For instructions, see Installing the MBAM 2.5 Server Software.
segment.target: For instructions, see Installing the MBAM 2.5 Server Software.

segment.source: On Server B, start the MBAM Server Configuration wizard, click Add New Features, and then select only the Self-Service Portal feature.
segment.target: On Server B, start the MBAM Server Configuration wizard, click Add New Features, and then select only the Self-Service Portal feature.

segment.source: Alternatively, you can use the Enable-MbamWebApplication Windows PowerShell cmdlet to configure the Self-Service Portal.
segment.target: Alternatively, you can use the Enable-MbamWebApplication Windows PowerShell cmdlet to configure the Self-Service Portal.

segment.source: For instructions on how to configure the Administration and Monitoring Website, see How to Configure the MBAM 2.5 Web Applications.
segment.target: For instructions on how to configure the Administration and Monitoring Website, see How to Configure the MBAM 2.5 Web Applications.

segment.source: If the client computers in your organization do not have access to the Microsoft Content Delivery Network, you also have to move the JavaScript files.
segment.target: If the client computers in your organization do not have access to the Microsoft Content Delivery Network, you also have to move the JavaScript files.

segment.source: See How to Configure the Self-Service Portal When Client Computers Cannot Access the Microsoft Content Delivery Network for more information.
segment.target: See How to Configure the Self-Service Portal When Client Computers Cannot Access the Microsoft Content Delivery Network for more information.

segment.source: Customize the Self-Service Portal for your organization.
segment.target: Customize the Self-Service Portal for your organization.

segment.source: Use the instructions in Customizing the Self-Service Portal for Your Organization to review your current customizations and to configure custom settings on the Self-Server Portal on Server B.
segment.target: Use the instructions in Customizing the Self-Service Portal for Your Organization to review your current customizations and to configure custom settings on the Self-Server Portal on Server B.

segment.target: Got a suggestion for MBAM?

segment.target: Use the MBAM TechNet Forum.
